comment: The course a little bit harder than expected as most students I know did not get a proper level of knowledge from math and physics I to take physics II. Professor offered many bonuses though. One test and two homework assignments with the lowest grade were dropped. He is carrying and tries to be inspirational but we just wanted to pass the course.
Straightforward, be familiar with the syllabus , course organization and you will be good to go! He is always willing to help and makes sure that nobody struggles.

Non mandatory classes, but he solves a lot of examples and practice problems in class. Provides study guides and studying them, and attending classes gave me a straight A. The course relays a lot on math, trigonometry and vectors. He is very helpful and fair grader, I would definitely take him again.

4 tests and a cumulative final. Can exempt if you have a 96 in the class & drops the lowest test grade. So I exempted the fourth and the final because I had a  97. Lots of webassign. Study guides are literally 200+ questions wrong with several wrong answers. He does not use numbers in class when teaching. He's a little stiff but he is fair.

Students taking this course for credit have different majors and the course seems to be more adjusted for students with not enough math background. Lectures are not mandatory, and with clear grading criteria and provided study guides, there are no surprises and frustrations.  Sometimes there is more than one homework assignment per week.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Uzelac is not the best professor, but I did like his grading policy. The test are pretty fair, and if you have a 96% (easy to get) you do not have to take the 5th test or the final. Just do the homework and you will be fine.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I'm not sure what's up with these other reviews being so positive. Prof. Uzelac knows his stuff, but does not do a good job conveying what he knows. Accent is no problem but I personally got nothing out of his lectures. Stopped going after the first test and have a 99.5% in his class. Easy A, useless lectures. Be prepared to teach yourself and read
He is the nicest most handsome professor I've ever had. His class is easy and his tests are open note/computer. No reason not too take him, easy A!

Prof Uzelac is a great professor. Don't be surprised if you feel overwhelmed on the first few weeks of class. His accent is hard to get a hang  of. But once you do, it should be relatively smooth sailing from there. Do all of your webassigns and study for your tests. Out of 5 tests (including final) the lowest grade will be dropped.

Awesome accent which makes you pay more attention to lectures! Don't be shy to ask questions because he will explain things further when asked, but otherwise he will assume you got it. Moves through material pretty quickly, so take notes! Very nice and knowledgeable professor!
